project_description:
Arkadia by Akashic Archive
"Where Gaming Communities Write Their Own Stories"

Arkadia is an open source platform that transforms how gaming communities create and share interactive experiences. Instead of relying on external developers, communities become the creators‚Äîbuilding custom minigames, hosting collaborative tournaments, and crafting unique gaming experiences tailored to their culture. Built on a modern stack of React 18, TypeScript, Vite, and Tailwind CSS for the frontend, with Express.js and Socket.io powering real-time backend interactions, and Discord.js v14 handling seamless bot integration across servers, all managed through pnpm workspaces in a monorepo architecture.

Our Mission: Democratize game development by providing communities with intuitive tools to create, share, and play games together. From quick Discord trivia sessions to elaborate web-based tournaments, every community can build entertainment that reflects their unique identity. The platform is designed to evolve from its current Node.js 18+ foundation to include PostgreSQL and Redis for persistent data, JWT authentication, OpenAI API integration for intelligent features, and expand into React Native mobile experiences, advanced Phaser.js and WebGL gaming, comprehensive Jest testing, and Docker containerization.

Why Arkadia Matters: Gaming communities shouldn't be limited to consuming what already exists. They should have the power to create what they envision. Arkadia bridges the gap between "I wish we had a game like..." and "We built exactly what we wanted," providing both the technical infrastructure and intuitive development tools that make community-driven game creation accessible to everyone, regardless of their programming experience.

The Vision: A world where every Discord server, gaming community, and friend group can collaboratively develop the perfect minigames for their gatherings‚Äîwithout needing to be professional developers. Built with the philosophy that the best games come from understanding your players, because you ARE the players.

üèõÔ∏è Developed by Akashic Archive | üåü GSSOC 2025

project_name: Cat Sanctuary - A Horror First-Person Game
project_description:
Cat Sanctuary is a horror-themed first-person game set in a haunted cat sanctuary. The player, a new caretaker, uncovers a dark mystery involving cursed spirits, eerie events, and the remains of a previous caretaker. The mission is to collect remains of that caretaker scattered across the map and bury them to break the curse and save the cats.
The game is built in Unity using custom C# scripts, shader graph visual effects, ambient sound design, and post-processing for atmosphere. GSSoC contributors can work on gameplay improvements, level design, optimizing scripts, adding features like new enemy AI or save/load mechanics, and porting the game to other platforms.

project_description:
It seems many of us struggle to stay on top of our health goals because the tools we use are just too complicated. The constant need to manually search for and log every single thing we eat can be a real motivation killer. That's the problem ThunderLean aims to solve.

The core of this project is its AI-Powered Food Tracking. You can simply type what you ate, like "oatmeal with almonds and honey," and our AI, powered by Gemini, will instantly give you all the nutritional details‚Äîcalories, protein, carbs, and fat‚Äîwithout any fuss. To help you understand your own body, ThunderLean includes a TDEE calculator to set personalized goals, whether you're trying to lose, maintain, or gain weight. You can also see your progress at a glance on the dashboard, which shows your daily stats and a calendar to track your streak. To keep you on track, the app provides simple, AI-driven tips tailored to your specific goals.

Behind the scenes, we're building this with a modern and robust tech stack. We're using React for a smooth, responsive front end, and Express.js for a powerful back end. The smart features are all possible thanks to integrating the Gemini API. This combination of a heartfelt mission and cutting-edge technology makes ThunderLean a project that's both impactful and exciting to work on.

project_description:
The development of the AI Resume Builder was guided by a prompt engineering-based approach rather than training or fine-tuning a large model from scratch. Since large language models like GPT-3.5 or Gemini 1.5 are already pre-trained on vast corpora, we chose to utilize their capabilities through carefully crafted zero-shot and few-shot prompts to generate resume summaries, skill recommendations, and professional language formatting. This allowed us to build a highly functional and resource-efficient solution without requiring high computational power or extensive model training.

We focused on iterative prompt design, where inputs from the user (education, skills, experience) are combined into a structured prompt that instructs the generative model to create a formal, concise resume summary. The main strategy was optimizing input instructions to yield the most humanlike and contextually appropriate output.

project_name: AI-Powered Attentiveness Monitor for Google Meet
project_description:
This is a high-performance, hackathon-grade system designed to provide real-time engagement analysis for teachers, presenters, and team leads during Google Meet sessions. It uses a powerful Python backend with a MediaPipe AI model to analyze video streams and a robust Chrome Extension to display the live results directly within the Google Meet interface.

The system tracks every visible participant, including the host, and provides a live, color-coded overlay with a constantly updating engagement score. At the end of the session, it can generate a detailed, multi-page PDF report summarizing the engagement levels of all participants. Key Features
üöÄ Real-Time Multi-Participant Analysis: Tracks every visible person simultaneously, providing independent and accurate engagement scores for each.
üß† Advanced AI Metrics: Goes beyond simple presence detection by analyzing:
Gaze Detection: Detects if a participant is looking away from the screen (e.g., at a phone).
Drowsiness: Uses Eye Aspect Ratio (EAR) to detect signs of sleepiness.
Yawning: Detects yawning as a potential indicator of fatigue or disinterest.
üìä Live Visual Feedback: Displays a clean, intuitive overlay on each participant's video tile, including:
A colored border (Green/Yellow/Red) representing their current engagement status.
A text label with their name, live score, and status (e.g., "Attentive", "Distracted").
üìã Comprehensive PDF Reporting: On-demand generation of a detailed PDF report for every tracked participant, featuring summary charts and engagement timelines. A minimum of 30 seconds of tracking is required to generate a report.
‚ö° Optimized Performance: Built with a state-managed, thread-safe Python backend and a lightweight Chrome Extension to ensure a smooth, lag-free experience.

previous_experience:
I have worked on three machine learning-based projects that demonstrate my skills in full-stack development and practical ML application:

FitInsight: Built a health prediction system that detects the risk of heart disease, obesity, and diabetes based on user input and returns personalized health recommendations. Used React for the frontend, Flask for the backend, and ML libraries like scikit-learn and TensorFlow.

Moodify: Created a mood-based music recommendation app using a CNN model trained on facial expression data. The user uploads a selfie, and based on the predicted mood, the app recommends a personalized playlist using the Spotify API.

DateLock: Developed an email scheduling system that lets users schedule emails for future delivery. The backend checks for scheduled times and automatically sends emails via the Gmail API. MongoDB was used to store scheduled emails, and Node.js handled the backend logic.

These projects reflect my ability to build real-world, resume-quality web applications that combine machine learning with responsive frontend design and robust backend systems.
tech_stack:
Tech Stack Used:

Frontend: React.js was used to build a responsive Single Page Application (SPA) interface with navigation between Home, About, and Recommendation pages. Users can select the health risk (heart disease, obesity, or diabetes) and input relevant data via interactive forms.

Backend: Flask was used to handle all API requests. It processes the user data, loads trained ML models, and returns risk predictions and personalized recommendations in JSON format.

Machine Learning: Trained models using scikit-learn and TensorFlow for predicting heart disease, obesity, and diabetes risks. KNN and Logistic Regression models were used for risk prediction. Separate models are maintained for each condition to ensure modularity and higher accuracy.
project_description:
FitInsight is an AI-powered web application that predicts health risks for *heart disease*, and *obesity* using machine learning models. Future plans include that based on the predicted risk level (low, medium, high), it should generate*personalized workout and diet recommendations* to help users improve their health and  we are planning to incorporate a *health alert system* that reminds users to take proactive actions.

Key Features:
- Predicts individual risk levels for heart disease, diabetes.(completed)
- Gives customized *diet plans and workout recommendations* using a KNN-based recommendation engine.(planned)
- Clean and intuitive *React-based frontend* and Flask-based backend.
- Easy-to-use form for health inputs with instant risk predictions
- Designed without login/signup so recruiters and contributors can test it instantly.

The project is fully open-source and hosted on GitHub, following best practices with a clear folder structure, proper documentation (`README.md`, `CONTRIBUTING.md`, `LICENSE`), and beginner-friendly open issues.

This project was created to contribute meaningfully to public health awareness, combining machine learning and web development to bring real impact.

project_description: IdeaVault is a SaaS-based licensing platform that enables registration of original software project ideas. It operates under a modified MIT-style license which includes a binding attribution clause. Upon registration, verified unique ideas are granted protected status. Any developer using a registered idea in a commercial product must, under the license terms, remit 1% of gross revenue to the registered idea owner. This obligation is contractual and enforceable. IdeaVault does not confer ownership but facilitates limited rights and revenue-sharing tied to ideation, ensuring recognition and compensation for original contributors.

project_description:
Mathforge is an open-source programming language and compiler designed to formalize, verify, and automate mathematical proofs. Its core aim is to provide mathematicians, students, and educators with a language that naturally expresses advanced mathematical logic‚Äîsuch as quantifiers (‚Äúfor all‚Äù, ‚Äúthere exists‚Äù), implications, and constructs common in analysis (epsilon-delta proofs, ‚Äúif and only if‚Äù statements, etc.)‚Äîin familiar notation.

Mathforge consists of:

A custom language tailored for mathematics and logic, supporting symbols (‚àÄ, ‚àÉ, ‚áí, ‚áî, Œµ, Œ¥), types, and proof structures.

A compiler with four classical stages (lexical analysis, parsing, semantic analysis, and code generation) capable of parsing¬†.mathforge¬†files and outputting human-readable explanations or formal representations.

A focus on accessibility for users who may not be experienced programmers, bridging rigorous mathematics and modern computational tools.

Goals of the project include:

Making mathematical proof scripting intuitive and efficient.

Enabling translation of Mathforge code to LaTeX, readable English, or other formal languages.

Providing a foundation for automated proof verification or symbolic computation in future phases.

Cultivating an open-source community around mathematical reasoning and education.

Mathforge aims to become a valuable tool for the mathematics community, fostering collaboration and rigor in mathematical communication.

project_description:
üìå Project Description ‚Äì EventMappr
EventMappr is a community-focused web application that allows users to discover, add, and explore local events on an interactive map. Built using React JS and Leaflet.js, the app provides a simple and intuitive interface to visualize nearby happenings like music events, tech meetups, volunteering drives, art fairs, and more.

Users can pin new events on the map by submitting a short form and selecting a location. The app also features event filtering by category and a geolocation-based search to find events near the user's current location. With no backend dependencies, EventMappr runs entirely in the browser and is a perfect example of what can be achieved with modern frontend tools alone.

Ideal for communities, colleges, and local networks ‚Äî EventMappr makes event discovery and sharing effortless.

project_description:
CodeClarity is an open-source AI-powered platform that helps learners and developers understand code with interactive explanations and visualizations. It supports popular languages like Python, JavaScript, C++, and Java, and turns code into 3D flowcharts, diagrams, and real-time walkthroughs.

We are building innovative features like:
- Voice-based explanation using Web Speech API  
- ‚ÄúWhy Mode‚Äù to explain code line-by-line  
- Time & space complexity analyzer  
- Live code execution with 3D variable tracking  
- Real-world analogies for code blocks  
- Quiz generator based on current code  
- Exportable diagrams and collaborative pair-explanation mode

Whether you're a beginner or advanced coder, CodeClarity aims to make code education visually engaging, beginner-friendly, and accessible. Contributors can work on frontend UI, backend logic, AI integration, documentation, and creative features.

We're even letting contributors vote on the final project name ‚Äî because this is *your* open-source journey too!

project_description:
Nitra Mitra is an open-source educational platform designed to support students of AKTU and similar technical universities by providing a centralized system for academic resources. Developed by students of NITRA Technical Campus, the project aims to make essential study material easily accessible, especially for students in under-resourced colleges.

The platform offers semester-wise and subject-wise notes, previous year question papers, syllabus documents, and event updates. It eliminates the need to search through multiple unofficial sources and provides a clean, organized interface focused on academic success.

Nitra Mitra is built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and MySQL, and is hosted on a custom domain. It is a beginner-friendly open-source project, welcoming contributors to improve features like responsive design, content upload automation, admin moderation tools, and search optimization.

This project aligns with the goals of GSSoC by fostering open collaboration, offering meaningful contributions for beginners and intermediate developers, and solving real student problems through technology.

project_description: OpenVoiceX is a powerful, open-source framework designed to help developers, businesses, and researchers build, deploy, and manage real-time voice-first AI systems. It brings together two complementary projects‚ÄîOpenVoiceOS and Voice Marketing Agents‚Äîinto a single, unified platform.  At its core, OpenVoiceX provides all the components you need to create sophisticated conversational assistants and AI-driven telephony agents. Whether it‚Äôs powering natural voice interactions on the web, automating phone calls for marketing and customer service, or experimenting with conversational AI research, OpenVoiceX gives you full control‚Äîwithout relying on expensive, proprietary APIs.  The system is designed to be modular and extensible. You can integrate your preferred speech-to-text, large language models, and text-to-speech engines. Everything runs in a self-hosted, containerized environment using Docker, making it easy to deploy on your infrastructure and maintain full data ownership.  A modern, web-based dashboard makes it possible to visually design, test, and manage your agents without writing code. For real-time voice interactions, OpenVoiceX achieves ultra-low latency pipelines, allowing conversations to flow naturally‚Äîeven with mid-sentence interruptions. It also supports traditional telephony services (like Twilio or Asterisk) and web-based voice clients out of the box.  By combining a developer-first architecture with enterprise-grade features like multi-tenancy, encryption, and API key management, OpenVoiceX is not just a toolkit‚Äîit‚Äôs a full-stack solution for building production-ready voice AI applications.

project_description: Project Description ‚Äì Web Cart  Web Cart is an innovative online platform designed to simplify website and application development for businesses, startups, and individuals. It acts as a digital marketplace where users can browse, purchase, and deploy pre-made websites and applications with just one click. Unlike traditional development cycles, Web Cart provides ready-to-use, customizable solutions that save time, cost, and effort.  The platform will also serve as a community-driven marketplace, enabling students, freelancers, and independent developers to upload and sell their pre-built websites and apps. This not only empowers developers to showcase their skills and earn but also ensures buyers have access to a wide variety of creative and cost-effective solutions.  Along with one-time purchases, Web Cart will offer subscription-based maintenance services, ensuring regular updates, bug fixes, and technical support for clients. Additionally, for businesses requiring tailored solutions, Web Cart will provide custom development services through its in-house team of professional developers.  By bridging the gap between ready-made templates, open-source contributions, and professional development, Web Cart aims to become a one-stop destination for entrepreneurs and companies looking to establish a strong digital presence quickly and affordably.

tech_stack: Streamlit (UI), TensorFlow + Keras (LSTM forecasting), Gemini AI (chatbot), yFinance (stock data), FRED API (macroeconomics), NewsAPI & GNews (news), Pandas & NumPy (data handling), Plotly & Matplotlib (visuals), Python-Dotenv (.env security).
project_description:
The Streamlit Financial Advisory Bot is an AI-powered financial dashboard designed to simplify stock market analysis, forecasting, and personal financial planning. Built with Streamlit, it combines deep learning (LSTM models), macroeconomic data, real-time stock insights, and a conversational Gemini AI chatbot to deliver a comprehensive investment assistant.

The platform allows users to track, analyze, and forecast stock prices using technical indicators like RSI and trend analysis, visualize candlestick charts, and even receive smart trading suggestions based on live market conditions. By integrating with yFinance, FRED API, NewsAPI, and GNews, it provides up-to-date stock data, macroeconomic indicators (GDP, inflation, interest rates), and summarized financial news for informed decision-making.

The Gemini AI chatbot acts as a personal advisor, answering questions like ‚ÄúIs it a good time to invest in AAPL?‚Äù or helping users create strategies. Users can also track their portfolios in real time, plan savings goals, and export reports in CSV format for deeper insights.

With secure API key management via .env, this tool is open-source friendly and safe for deployment. It serves as a powerful assistant for individual investors, traders, and financial enthusiasts, merging AI-driven forecasting, data visualization, and interactive financial planning into a single dashboard.

project_description:
Sheraksha is a women‚Äôs safety and emergency alert system designed to provide quick, reliable help during moments of distress. Built during an open innovation hackathon, Sheraksha combines modern web technologies and APIs to empower users to send SOS alerts with their real-time location to trusted contacts instantly.

Recognizing that personal safety remains a critical concern for women worldwide, Sheraksha focuses on simplicity and effectiveness. It features a one-tap emergency alert button that, when activated, fetches the user‚Äôs current GPS coordinates using the Google Maps API and sends SMS alerts via the Twilio API to all saved emergency contacts. These alerts contain a preset message along with a live location link, enabling contacts to respond swiftly. Additionally, Sheraksha supports voice-activated SOS triggers for hands-free emergency activation.

Technically, Sheraksha is a full-stack web app with a clean, responsive frontend built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, paired with a secure backend developed in Python using the Flask framework. It manages user authentication, emergency contact management, API integrations, and alert logging. The app is accessible on both desktop and mobile browsers, ensuring help is always within reach.

Challenges such as ensuring accurate location tracking and reliable message delivery were addressed through rigorous testing and the use of robust APIs. Privacy and security were prioritized through encrypted data transmission and secure user authentication.

Sheraksha reflects my passion as a full-stack developer, AI enthusiast, and cybersecurity advocate to create impactful solutions that improve real lives. Moving forward, I plan to enhance Sheraksha with features like integration with emergency services, AI-driven threat detection, and wearable device compatibility to make safety even more accessible and proactive.

tech_stack: ml, ai, deep learning,nltk, pytorch, tensorflow,numpy
project_name: Time Series Analysis and forcasting for Stock Market
project_description:
Key Points

1. Time Series Analysis ‚Äì Examines past stock market data to detect trends (upward/downward), cycles, volatility, and seasonality.


2. Forecasting ‚Äì Uses statistical and machine learning models (e.g., ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, LSTM) to predict future stock prices or returns.


3. Applications ‚Äì Helps in investment decision-making, risk management, and algorithmic trading.


4. Limitations ‚Äì Market is influenced by unpredictable external factors (news, policies, global events), so forecasts are probabilistic, not exact.



Recommendation: Use Time Series Analysis for pattern discovery and risk-aware predictions.
Next step: Apply models like ARIMA or LSTM on historical stock data for practical forecasting.

project_description:
Discord.py Masterclass is a comprehensive, multi-page online tutorial designed to teach you how to build Discord bots using the discord.py library, step-by-step.

It starts from the very beginning: installing Python (version 3.8 or higher), setting up your development environment, configuring a Discord application and bot account, and enabling required intents like message content and server members.

Progresses through fundamental concepts: connecting to events, sending messages, prefix-based commands versus hybrid (text + slash) commands, and organizing code with Cogs.

It covers intermediate to advanced features:

Hybrid Commands ‚Äì commands that work both as prefix and slash commands.

Slash Commands, including usage and restriction options like guild_only.

Views and UI components (buttons, pagination) along with an embedded multi‚Äëpage help system using reactions or the modern UI views system.

Additional utilities: Custom Context, Error Handling, Argument Converters, Embeds, Checks, Background Tasks, ANSI/Markdown formatting, and even Audio Playback capabilities.

A dedicated Examples section includes ready‚Äëto‚Äërun demos like paginated help commands, cogs structure, and more.

The goal is to extend this guide and add support and showcase more features, and refine a few existing ones, and also add cookbook style examples integrating discord with multiple other applications or sdks. Few such examples include Oauth based dashboard, different DBs, LLMs+MCP, Agentic Workflows, Sharding etc.

project_description:
Farm2U is a digital platform designed to connect farmers directly with consumers, eliminating unnecessary middlemen and ensuring fair prices for both producers and buyers. The system enables farmers to list fresh produce, dairy, and other agricultural goods, while consumers can browse, order, and receive deliveries straight from the source.

By integrating features such as real-time inventory updates, secure payment gateways, and location-based logistics, Farm2U aims to enhance supply chain transparency and reduce food wastage. The platform also supports seasonal crop promotions, farmer profiles, and product traceability, empowering buyers to make informed choices about the food they purchase.

The primary goals of Farm2U are:

To improve farmer income by offering a fair trade marketplace.

To provide consumers with fresh, affordable, and traceable produce.

To create a sustainable and efficient agricultural supply chain.

This project addresses key challenges in the agri-business ecosystem, including supply chain inefficiency, lack of price transparency, and limited access to fresh produce in urban areas. Through a user-friendly mobile and web application, Farm2U envisions bridging the gap between farm and table, fostering trust, and promoting sustainable agricultural practices.

MooVit uses YOLOv8, YOLOv11, and YOLOv12 with OpenCV for real-time object detection of vehicles, people, animals, traffic signals, and sharp objects. It also includes face recognition using DeepFace or FaceNet to help visually impaired users identify and follow known individuals.

The system is built with Python for backend processing, using Flask or FastAPI for APIs and pyttsx3 or gTTS for voice alerts. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are used to create the frontend interface with webcam access and visual feedback through the Canvas and MediaDevices APIs.

The frontend is deployed on Vercel, and the codebase is managed using GitHub. WebSocket and HTTP Fetch are used for real-time communication between the client and server. The project is modular and open to contributions across AI, web, and accessibility features.
project_description: MooVit is an AI-powered real-time object detection and safety assistant designed for visually impaired users and traffic awareness. It uses YOLOv8, YOLOv11, and YOLOv12 with OpenCV to detect vehicles, people, animals, traffic signals, sharp objects, and known faces from cameras, images, and videos. The system provides voice alerts for dangers and helps blind users follow known individuals using face recognition. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the frontend (deployed on Vercel) and Python for backend processing, MooVit supports accessibility, real-time safety, and intelligent guidance in road environments.

project_description:
Project Overview ‚Äì ECO-TRACE: E-Waste Classification System

ECO-TRACE is an intelligent e-waste management and classification platform designed to monitor and assess the environmental impact of electronic waste. It uses modern web technologies and data science tools to help researchers, environmentalists, and organizations identify and manage e-waste more efficiently.

Built using both Flask and Django, ECO-TRACE collects and processes data in real time, using machine learning models (Scikit-learn, NumPy) to classify various types of e-waste. It also employs OpenCV for analyzing images of discarded electronic items (e.g., identifying circuit boards, batteries, screens, etc.) from field or satellite imagery.

The platform features:

Interactive dashboards for visualizing e-waste data.

Automated PDF reports summarizing waste categories and environmental impact.

Secure login system for different user roles.

WebSocket support for real-time updates.

API integrations with external IoT sensors and environmental tools.

Containerized deployment for scalability and easy hosting.

ECO-TRACE helps communities and organizations make informed decisions on recycling, disposal, and reducing environmental harm caused by electronic waste.

project_description:
OnePkg is a cross-distro command-line tool that helps Linux users quickly search, discover, and install software packages from multiple sources with a single unified interface.

Instead of remembering separate commands for each package manager (pacman, apt, dnf, yay, flatpak, etc.), users can simply run OmniPkg to:

Search for packages across different package managers

Auto-generate installation commands for the chosen manager

Provide a clean, beginner-friendly CLI interface

Extend support for AUR, PyPI, and other repositories

This project aims to simplify the Linux package management experience for both beginners and power users, while also being lightweight, fast, and extensible.

project_description:
Blok is
‚Äã
a new kind of backend development.
Most backend frameworks focus on features. Blok focuses on clarity. It gives developers the power to build modular, testable, observable systems from the ground up‚Äîwithout having to adopt complex orchestration platforms or serverless lock-in.

As a Blok developer, you don‚Äôt build backends by routing HTTP requests into controllers. You build workflows composed of focused nodes, observe them in real time, test each unit independently, and deploy them across runtimes or teams.

project_description:
I‚Äôm building the first ‚ÄúAI-native CFO Co-pilot‚Äù‚Äîa modular, cloud-based platform that automates, augments, and connects every major finance function for India's fastest-growing businesses. Our technology leverages the best LLMs globally (FinGPT, GPT-4o, Claude, Arya.ai, DataRobot, and more) for hyper-automation, deeply actionable insights, and continuous compliance, all at a pricing model that democratizes access for both scale-ups and market leaders.

What Problem Do We Solve‚ÄîAnd Why Now?
Indian and Asian mid-to-large companies still run finance ops on disconnected, manual-heavy processes, with huge drag from outdated FP&A, reporting, and risk workflows.

Global solutions‚Äîwhile powerful‚Äîare expensive, slow to adapt to Indian realities, and rarely integrate best-in-class AI or plug-and-play APIs for scale.

We unify and automate everything the modern CFO needs: strategic planning, fraud/risk, scenario and ESG, investor/market monitoring, and even real-time cash/trading‚Äîreplacing a patchwork of slow, expensive solutions with an integrated, API-driven engine.

Why Is This Unique?
LLM Routing: Every finance task is handled by the best specialist AI‚Äîbringing enterprise-grade intelligence within reach of Indian SMEs and multinationals.

Open, Modular, and API-First: Can plug into any ERP, CRM, BI, or fintech tool‚Äîperfect for B2B and partnership models.

Local Compliance, Global-Ready: Built for GAAP/IFRS, Indian tax/currency, and seamless multilingual use out of the gate.

Usage-based and Tiered Pricing: Removes sticker shock. Companies pay what they use, scale features/entities as they grow.

Actionable Insights: Not just charts and dashboards‚Äîour AI makes direct recommendations, auto-documents outcomes, and shortens decision cycles.

CinderPeak is a fast and efficient, open-source C++ graph library designed to handle directed, undirected, and mixed graphs with customizable vertex and edge types. The library includes an integrated visualization engine powered by SFML, enabling intuitive graph rendering for visual insights. CinderPeak is thread-safe, portable, and optimized for integration into larger projects, making it ideal for graph theory applications, data analysis, and network modeling.

project_description:
VAISH ‚Äî Ultra-Modern AI Discord Bot Framework is an open-source, next-generation Discord bot solution designed for modern communities, gaming servers, and large-scale deployments. It combines powerful automation, AI-driven features, and complete code ownership ‚Äî all with zero subscription fees or vendor lock-in. Built using Discord.js v14, Node.js 18+, MongoDB Atlas, Google Gemini AI, and Mongoose, VAISH delivers intelligent conversations, advanced moderation, community rewards, and a beautiful, responsive user interface. The framework offers developer-friendly architecture, scalable database integration, and seamless cloud deployment to platforms like Render, Railway, or private servers.

As an open-source project, VAISH welcomes contributors to build their own custom bots, develop new AI features, enhance performance, and improve documentation. Our mission is to empower Discord communities with secure, AI-powered automation tools while fostering global collaboration. Developers passionate about Discord, AI, or open-source innovation are invited to join VAISH and help shape the future of intelligent, community-driven Discord bots.

project_description:
CodeHert is a full-stack online judge platform for practicing Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA). Built with the MERN stack, it enables users to solve coding problems, submit solutions in multiple languages (C++, Java, Python), and receive instant automated feedback with verdicts like Accepted, Wrong Answer, or Time Limit Exceeded. 
Key features include user authentication, problem management, secure Dockerized code execution with resource limits, AI-powered code reviews using Gemini API, admin panels for problem creation, and comprehensive user profiles with statistics. The compiler service is deployed on AWS EC2 with CI/CD pipelines for secure code execution, while the platform serves as a complete coding practice environment similar to LeetCode¬†or¬†Codeforces.
Live Demo: https://codehert.dev
The project welcomes contributions in areas like UI/UX improvements, additional language support, testing, documentation, and new features. It's an excellent opportunity for contributors to learn full-stack development, DevOps, and system design while building a real-world¬†application.

project_description:
Where is My Bus, developed under Trackila Smart Innovations Pvt. Ltd., is a next-generation platform designed to revolutionize public transportation through real-time bus tracking, accurate schedules, and seamless travel planning.

Our mission is to eliminate uncertainty in public commuting by providing GPS-enabled live tracking, instant ETAs, and route optimization. The platform serves daily commuters, students, and travelers, offering them reliable transport information right at their fingertips.

This system not only benefits passengers but also helps transport authorities by improving fleet management, reducing delays, and enhancing passenger satisfaction ‚Äî driving forward the vision of smart and connected mobility.

Core Features:
Live GPS Tracking ‚Äì Real-time location updates for buses on an interactive map.

Accurate ETA Calculation ‚Äì AI-powered ETA based on live traffic and bus speed.

Complete Route & Stop Info ‚Äì Detailed bus routes, stops, and transfer points.

Real-Time Alerts ‚Äì Delay notifications, route changes, and breakdown alerts.

Advanced Search & Filters ‚Äì Locate buses by number, route, or destination.

Offline Data Access ‚Äì Saved schedules and routes even without internet.

Transport Authority Dashboard ‚Äì Manage fleets, schedules, and GPS devices.

project_description: Univest AI Voice and Chat Agent is a multimodal conversational AI system engineered to deliver real-time, context-aware interactions through both telephonic and text-based interfaces. Architected using Python, Flask, and an asynchronous microservice architecture, the system integrates Groq's ultra-low-latency LLM for intelligent response generation, Deepgram for high-fidelity streaming speech-to-text transcription, and Vosk for offline multilingual ASR support. The voice agent leverages Exotel‚Äôs programmable telephony API to automate outbound calling workflows, enabling natural dialogue execution directly over phone networks. The chatbot counterpart shares a unified backend, ensuring consistent language understanding and response behavior across modalities. The application features webhook-driven call control, modular API orchestration, and live context preservation for multi-turn conversations. With a focus on high throughput, low latency, and production-grade reliability, this project demonstrates advanced capabilities in speech processing, LLM integration, voice UX design, and full-stack AI deployment. It serves as a scalable, intelligent engagement layer tailored for enterprise-grade use cases in fintech and beyond.

High‚Äëthroughput data streams move through Kafka, lightweight sensor events travel via MQTT, and Redis accelerates caching and job queues. A modern TypeScript front end built with Next.js‚ÄØ14 and styled with TailwindCSS visualises insights through Recharts dashboards. Everything ships in Docker‚ÄëCompose, integrates with GitHub‚ÄØActions for CI/CD, and can be provisioned to AWS‚ÄØEKS using Terraform.
project_name: Retail with purpose: Building a sustainable and responsible future
project_description:
Sustainability is no longer an option‚Äîit‚Äôs a necessity. As consumers demand more eco-conscious choices, retailers must reimagine their operations to reduce waste, lower carbon footprints and create a more responsible supply chain. From sustainable sourcing and eco-friendly packaging to energy-efficient store designs and AI-driven waste reduction, innovation is transforming how businesses operate while ensuring long-term environmental and economic benefits.

Walmart is at the forefront of this shift, leveraging AI to optimize supply chains and minimize waste. Their collaboration with GreenPod Labs is revolutionizing the way fresh produce is stored and transported, extending shelf life and significantly reducing food waste. These AI-powered strategies are ensuring fresher products, less spoilage and a more efficient distribution process, setting a new standard for sustainability in retail. Read more here.

Beyond food sustainability, retailers are embracing circular economy models, closed-loop recycling systems and smart energy management to reduce emissions and drive impact at scale. The future of retail is not just about selling products‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating a positive, lasting impact on the planet and society.

Think of solutions that retail businesses can leverage to push the boundaries of sustainability. Can your ideas lead to innovations in green logistics, zero-waste supply chains, ethical sourcing or carbon-neutral retail operations? Think beyond today‚Äôs solutions and help shape a smarter, greener and more responsible future for retail.
